articleinfo.releaseinfo: This manual describes version 2.15.2 of Time Administration Tool.

legalnotice.title: Återkoppling
legalnotice.para: För att rapportera ett fel eller komma med förslag angående Tidsadministrationsverktyget eller denna handbok, följ anvisningarna på GNOME:s återkopplingssida.

abstract.para: The Time Administration Tool allows you to set the time, date and timezone of your system, as well as setting any time server to synchronize your local time server.

sect1.title: Introduktion
sect1.para: The Time Administration Tool allows you to set the time, date and timezone of your system, as well as setting any time server to synchronize your local time server.

sect1.title: Komma igång
sect1.para: Du kan starta Tidsadministrationsverktyg på följande sätt:

varlistentry.term: Context menu in the clock applet

sect1.para: When you start Time Administration Tool, you will be prompted for the administrator password, this is necessary because the changes done with this tool will affect the whole system.
After entering the administrator password, the following window is displayed.
The Time Administration Tool main window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: Detta låter dig ändra din systemtid.
Displays your current timezone, the button displays a map for selecting timezone.
This enables or disables your local NTP server, the button beside it displays a list of internet servers.

sect2.title: För att ändra din tid eller datum
sect2.para: Just change the time spin buttons or the date in the calendar.

sect2.title: För att ändra din tidszon
sect2.para: Click on the Select time zone button and select the new location, alternatively you can also select the new location from the list below.

textobject.phrase: Shows Time Administration Tool map window.

sect2.title: To synchronize your local time server with internet time servers
sect2.para: If the checkbox is disabled, enable it, then click on the Select servers button and select a new server in the list.

textobject.phrase: Shows Time Administration Tool servers window.
